verses.kjv: Help, LORD; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.
verses.ct: Save us, LORD, because devoted people are disappearing; trustworthy people can no longer be found among humanity.

verses.kjv: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.
verses.ct: Everyone lies to their neighbor; they speak with flattering words and deceptive hearts.

verses.kjv: The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:
verses.ct: The LORD will silence every flattering mouth and every tongue that boasts arrogantly—

verses.kjv: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?
verses.ct: those who say, 'We will win with our words; our mouths belong to us — who has authority over us?'

verses.kjv: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the LORD; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.
verses.ct: "Because the poor are being crushed and the needy are crying out, I will now rise up," says the LORD. "I will place them in the safety they long for."

verses.kjv: The words of the LORD are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.
verses.ct: The words of the LORD are flawless words, like silver refined in a furnace, purified 7 times over.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt keep them, O LORD, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.
verses.ct: You will protect them, LORD; you will guard them from this generation forever.

verses.kjv: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.
verses.ct: The wicked roam freely on every side whenever the most corrupt people are given positions of honor.
